bug.author: parulnith
bug.summary: Installing the library through conda defaults to the pre 2.0.0 version.
bug.description: While pip lets you install the 2.0.+ version, conda still defaults to the old 1.4.1 version and even with explicit expression, it doesn't work. Is it advisable to download the library from the source as of now?

comments.comment: Thank you for reporting this issue. We are aware that pandas-profiling on conda is not up to date. However, the maintenance of conda-forge is not done by us. More information: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/conda-forge/pandas-profiling-feedstock/pulls>https://github.com/conda-forge/pandas-profiling-feedstock/pulls</denchmark-link>

Sorry for my ignorance on this, but I just checked the conda-forge feedstock PRs and it looks like the automated checks have been passed. Do you know what else needs to be done to get conda-forge to accept the updated version? I'm not familiar with that workflow but am desperate to get v2 available on conda-forge.
